ca.mcgill.ecse211.project.menu

Class MainMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.tools.SubMenu
      • ca.mcgill.ecse211.project.menu.MainMenu

  • public class MainMenu
extends SubMenu
    This is the Main Menu of the robot. By default it contains three menu items, the Tests Menu, the Demos Menu, and the Calibration Menu. If either of these two options are chosen from the robot, that respective menu's options will be displayed. All of the options of this class run in the original thread that calls select() on this instance, and all menus afterward would do the same.

    More menu options can be added to this list by adding to getInstance() defined in this class.

    Example of adding a new menu option: 

     menu.addItem("Title of option", new MenuAction() {
   public boolean action() {
     System.out.println("I called a method from a menu item");
     return false; // return true to exit the current menu
   }
 });
    Author:
    Ryan Au auryan898@gmail.com

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static MainMenu getInstance()
        Creates and returns an instance of SubMenu that contains menu items specific to the MainMenu in the form of MenuAction instances or MenuCommand instances. Each of these actions are essentially run in the main thread, but the user running the program gets to pick which commands to run at the times they wish via the menu displayed on the LCD of the EV3.
        Returns:
        Returns the same instance of MainMenu every time.
        See Also:
        MenuCommand, MenuAction

      • createDemoMenu

        protected SubMenu createDemoMenu()
        Gets the menu instance created in the DemosMenu class.
        Returns:
        a SubMenu instance containing predefined actions

      • createCalibrationMenu

        protected SubMenu createCalibrationMenu()
        Gets the menu instance created in the CalibrationMenu class
        Returns:
        a SubMenu instance containing predefined actions
